intro: Erigeron pecosensis, commonly known as Pecos fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Erigeron pecosensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments with minimal water availability.
